title: Drawing, "Altar"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the altar in -1373. A tub sarcophagus fills the hollow. The lateral panels are empty. The furniture with the tabernacle is in teh scheme of 1901-39-2625, with a different design of the mouldings. Usual background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Altar".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1364.
